page.title: 05Mixed farming in S.Derbys.
page.content: Church Flatts Farm, 1.6km north north-east of Lullington has a greater variety of animals than Creamery Farm. It is a family business. The total area of 91 acres supports 70 Friesian dairy cows, 1 bull and 50 young beast. Other livestock include 60 sheep, 75 lambs, 2 ducks and some hens. Barley and oats are grown to provide fodder for the livestock many of which are fed intensively indoors. Potatoes are sold to local wholesalers. 3 tractors and other assorted equipment is used regularly on the farm. Larger machinery needed on a seasonal basis is supplied by contractors.
